question: The I – V graph for a conductor at two different temperatures 100°C and 400°C is as shown in the figure. The temperature coefficient of resistance of the conductor is about (in per degree Celsius)
images/b2c3d4e5-f6a1-4b2c-9d0e-901234567801.png
explanation: Slope of I-V is 1/R. 400°C corresponds to lower slope (higher R, 30°). 100°C corresponds to higher slope (lower R, 45°).
